content.en: Cancer prognosis prediction: Scientists have been investigating the role of specific long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) in various types of cancer, such as lung adenocarcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, and colorectal cancer. They are using algorithms, such as Cox regression analysis and the least absolute shrinkage and selection operator (LASSO) algorithm, to construct signatures or models that can predict the prognosis, immune response, and immunotherapy efficacy for these cancers. These findings could potentially improve the accuracy of prognosis prediction and help guide personalized treatment decisions for cancer patients.
content.da: Prognose for kræft: Forskere har undersøgt rollen af specifikke lange ikke-kodende RNA'er (lncRNA'er) i forskellige typer kræft, såsom lungeadenokarcinom, hepatocellulært karcinom og kolorektal kræft. De bruger algoritmer, såsom Cox regressionsanalyse og Least Absolute Shrinkage and Selection Operator (LASSO) algoritmen, til at konstruere signaturer eller modeller, der kan forudsige prognosen, immunresponsen og effektiviteten af immunterapi for disse kræfttyper. Disse resultater kunne potentielt forbedre nøjagtigheden af prognoseforudsigelsen og hjælpe med at vejlede personlige behandlingsbeslutninger for kræftpatienter.
